DataElement.preferredName: Organ Enlargement Present Anatomic Site Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the anatomic site, not previously specified, where organ enlargement is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._The act of increasing (something) in size or volume or quantity or scope._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.:The act of increasing (something) in size or volume or quantity or scope.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.
